channel.title: MySQL Snapshotting on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in MySQL Snapshotting on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Instant Backup of MySQL
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Database Snapshots This tutorial will show you how to take snapshots of a KubeDB managed MySQL database. Note: The yaml files used in this tutorial are stored in docs/examples/mysql folder in GitHub repository kubedb/cli. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.

item.title: Scheduled Backup of MySQL
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Database Scheduled Snapshots This tutorial will show you how to use KubeDB to take scheduled snapshot of a MySQL database. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using Minikube.
